Tell Me More

About W4P

If you need a way to crowdsource innovation projects, we might have a solution. W4P is an Open Crowdsourcing platform designed to host single projects that are looking for funding (donation or reward based), volunteers, coaching or materials.

Easy to set-up

We've made our platform as lightweight as possible. Download our code, host it yourself and follow the installation wizard. Plus, our code is documented well if you want change certain features or parameters.

Responsive Design

Not only does it look good on your computer, it looks and feel good on any device. And the front page is your project landing page. No messy overview of multiple projects. You can focus on your project.

Open Source

It's your platform, so don't be prude, make it your own, add your branding and colour schemes. Have a lot of projects and different themes? Just host multiple instances that focus on your specific targetgroups.

History

How did W4P start?

  • March 2014

    It all started with a common problem

    Open Knowledge Belgium and iDROPS met up to discuss overlapping projects and goals and quickly found a common problem, funding. It's really hard these days to fund relative small projects that only have local impact. We thought crowdsourcing could be an opportunity but social innovation projects are often fading on large crowdfunding websites.

  • September 2014

    An idea turned in a project proposal

    Six months later, we found the perfect project call. Chest project - Call3 was looking for Open Source innovation projects that transform social innovation. We submitted and hoped for the best.

  • October 2015

    Project approved, time to work

    Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipisicing elit. Sunt ut voluptatum eius sapiente, totam reiciendis temporibus qui quibusdam, recusandae sit vero unde, sed, incidunt et ea quo dolore laudantium consectetur!

  • June 2016

    The future will hold a crowdsourcing platform

    Our project period ends on the end of May, so in June 2016 we will have released our shiny news Open Source platform

Secondary pages

Secondary pages are kept to a strict minimum to not distract end-users from the project page on the front. They are used to explain how the platform works or provide the necessary space for Terms of use and privacy policies, which are vital on any crowdsourcing platform.

  • Designer:
  • Date: February 2016
  • Funder: Design

Support Page

After deciding to help out the project a user can choose how. They can provide a donation or reward-based funding, or volunteer, offer coaching or materials.

  • Designer:
  • Date: February 2016
  • Funder: Design

Project page

The front page is the one-stop shop for all end users. It contains the information about the project in a single glance. No need to find the right project or maintaining project curation.

  • Designer:
  • Date: February 2016
  • Funder: Design
